page.title: 03HOUSING IN THE AREA
page.content: Housing in the area can be divided into the following broad catagories. 1.) Pre-war terraced, built to meet the needs of the increased work force connected with the growth of the coal industry. 2).Post-war council built housing estates 3)Private dwellings of a mixed kind. The terraced houses would be built of local stone or brick and would follow a uniform pattern. A door leading directly from the street into a small passage way and stairs. There would be a small room at the front of the house kept as a parlour or "Best room". At the rear would be the living room cum kitchen in which there would be an open coal fire place with oven. This room would also contain a small sink and the family effectively spent most of their time in this room.
